sections.text:
This change improves the accuracy of our stalled-deal alerting by fixing a specific false positive: “no next meeting scheduled” triggering even when a future meeting exists. Today, reps can receive an incorrect follow-up recommendation despite having already booked a next step, which reduces trust in the product and adds avoidable noise to their workflow.

We will update the rule evaluation in `sales_followup_recommendations` to look for upcoming meetings across all synced sources, including both CRM events and calendar-linked meetings, rather than relying on a single source or incomplete linkage. The logic will also explicitly ignore canceled and no-show events so we don’t treat non-actionable meetings as valid “next meetings,” while still recognizing legitimately scheduled future conversations.

User impact is primarily a reduction in erroneous stalled-deal notifications and fewer unnecessary tasks created off the back of those alerts. Reps and managers should see recommendations that better match reality, improving confidence in follow-up guidance and reducing time spent reconciling alerts with their calendars/CRM.

To prevent regressions, we’ll add a focused set of unit/integration tests covering the most common failure modes we’ve observed: rescheduled meetings (old event canceled, new event created), timezone boundary issues (meeting “tomorrow” vs “today”), and missing event IDs/linkage between CRM and calendar records. Success will be measured by a drop in false-positive “no next meeting scheduled” alerts and stable/unchanged detection of truly meeting-less opportunities.
